perturbation.original_text:
PC Quote is not subject to liability for truth, accuracy, or
          completeness of the market data information nor is PC Quote liable
          for errors, mistakes or omissions in the data or for any delays or
          interruptions in the end user's receipt of the data.  PC Quote does
          not warrant that the data provided may be relied upon for trading
          purposes."
perturbation.changed_text:
"PC Quote is not subject to liability for truth, accuracy, or
          completeness of the market data information."
perturbation.explanation: By removing the disclaimer that PC Quote does not warrant the data for trading purposes, we eliminate a clause that protects the consumer. Financial regulations require disclaimers regarding the reliability of market data for trading decisions. Removing this might expose PC Quote to liability and contradicts consumer protection laws requiring transparency in financial data services.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Securities Exchange Act of 1934; Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act

perturbation.original_text:
LIABILITY UNDER THIS AGREEMENT FROM ANY AND ALL CAUSES, INCLUDING,
BUT NOT LIMITED TO, PROGRAM MALFUNCTION OR OPERATIONAL NEGLIGENCE, SHALL BE
LIMITED TO GENERAL MONEY DAMAGES IN AN AMOUNT NOT TO EXCEED THE TOTAL CHARGES
PAID BY ABW FOR THE SERVICES DURING THE MOST RECENT TWELVE (12) MONTHS OF THE
AGREEMENT. SUCH LIMITATION SHALL BE THE EXTENT OF PCQ OR ABW'S LIABILITY
REGARDLESS OF THE FORM IN WHICH ANY LEGAL OR EQUITABLE ACTION MAY BE BROUGHT
AGAINST PCQ OR ABW, AND THE FOREGOING SHALL CONSTITUTE PCQ'S OR ABW'S SOLE
REMEDY.  IN NO EVENT WILL EITHER PARTY BE RESPONSIBLE FOR LOST PROFITS OR
SPECIAL INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES WHICH ABW OR PCQ INCUR
OR EXPERIENCE ON ACCOUNT OF ENTERING INTO OR RELYING ON THIS AGREEMENT, EVEN
IF PCQ OR ABW HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES.
perturbation.changed_text:
LIABILITY UNDER THIS AGREEMENT FROM ANY AND ALL CAUSES SHALL BE
LIMITED TO GENERAL MONEY DAMAGES. IN NO EVENT WILL EITHER PARTY BE RESPONSIBLE FOR LOST PROFITS OR
SPECIAL INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES WHICH ABW OR PCQ INCUR
OR EXPERIENCE ON ACCOUNT OF ENTERING INTO OR RELYING ON THIS AGREEMENT, EVEN
IF PCQ OR ABW HAS BEEN ADVISED OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES.
perturbation.explanation: Removing the clause that limits liability to the amount paid in the last 12 months weakens the protection for ABW. While limiting liability is generally permissible, complete removal can be challenged, especially regarding gross negligence or willful misconduct. This omission introduces legal risk and contradicts general contract law principles regarding fair dealing.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law; Uniform Commercial Code

perturbation.original_text:
This Agreement shall be interpreted, construed and enforced in all respects
in accordance with the laws of the State of Illinois, except with regards to its
rules regarding choice of law.  Each party irrevocably consents to the
jurisdiction of the courts of the State of Illinois and the federal courts
situated in the State of Illinois, in connection with any action to enforce the
provisions of this Agreement, to recover damages or other relief for breach or
default under this Agreement, or otherwise arising under or by reason of this
Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
This Agreement shall be interpreted, construed and enforced in all respects
in accordance with the laws of the State of Illinois.
perturbation.explanation: By omitting the part about 'Each party irrevocably consents to the jurisdiction of the courts of the State of Illinois and the federal courts situated in the State of Illinois', we're removing the explicit agreement to jurisdiction. While the default jurisdiction might still be Illinois based on other factors, the lack of explicit consent could allow a party to argue for a different venue, potentially violating legal expectations and increasing litigation costs. This conflicts with standard legal practices that aim to ensure clarity and predictability in jurisdictional matters.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Federal Rules of Civil Procedure, State of Illinois Civil Practice Law
